text: hi my name is Fiona Ford I'm a
construction manager here at AWS for the
last 15 months in the construction team
we construct world renowned data centers
across emea so as a construction manager
based in Dublin I am building out data
centers here in Dublin
I studied to be a mechanical engineer
when I was in university I then
relocated to Vancouver Canada for a year
which turned into nine years over there
I worked as a consultant engineer and
then transitioned into construction
manager role I then relocated back to
Dublin and started working with AWS as a
construction manager here in a minute
there's a large team of construction
managers we work in a very collaborative
way we all come from different
backgrounds electrical Mechanicals civil
engineers and we pull from each other's
strengths and help each other in the
construction of world leading data
centers the most exciting part of my job
is that every day is different we have
new challenges new problems to solve and
we work at a very fast pace
the biggest surprise I've found since
joining AWS is how much we focus on the
customer from previous employers a lot
of decisions were dictated by what
competitors were doing but here at the
core of every decision is customer
I think people have a perception that in
order to work in a data center you have
to be able to write code
I can't write code but there's so many
opportunities for multiple different
type of people with different
backgrounds to work in data centers
I maintain a good work-life balance in
the fact that AWS is results driven once
you meet your project milestones and
targets I don't take work commonly
so I'm actually involved in the get it
ambassador program here in Dublin to get
ambassador program is an initiative that
was started to try increased diversity
within the tech industry so I call out
to different schools mainly dealing with
young girls and fourth fifth and sixth
year to show them and Inspire them to
show that there is career opportunities
in the tech industry the thing that I
love most about Dublin is the history
the culture and the people
walking there on any Street you'll see
the buildings have stories to them in
comparison to other parts of the world
that I've lived in
